description: Named for John Trudgen (1852-1902), an English swimmer who popularised the stroke.

entries.meaning: (swimming) A swimming stroke in which the left and right hands are alternately raised out of the water, brought forward and drawn back through the water. A scissor kick is performed on every second stroke.

verbs.description: trudgen (third-person singular simple present trudgens, present participle trudgening, simple past and past participle trudgened)
